meanings.sent1: She accidentally misbinds the pages of her book together.
meanings.sent2: He learned not to misbind the shoelaces to avoid tripping.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy wizard would always misbind his spells, causing unexpected results.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to misbind the puzzle pieces together only made it more challenging.
meanings.sent5: The tailor's mistake to misbind the fabric resulted in a crooked seam.

meanings.definition: To fasten together in a faulty or unsuitable manner.
meanings.sent1: The student would often misbind his notes in a rush.
meanings.sent2: They had to redo the project because they misbind the parts together.
meanings.sent3: The chef's decision to misbind the ingredients created a strange dish.
meanings.sent4: The vines seemed to misbind themselves around the old tree.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to fix the engine after someone misbind the wires.
